TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BlockUIContainer extends System.Windows.Documents.Block

Docs.summary: A block-level flow content element which enables elements (i.e. a ) to be embedded (hosted) in flow content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> element (i.e. a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>) may be embedded directly in flow content by enclosing it in a BlockUIContainer (see example below).
An BlockUIContainer may directly host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> child. However, the child element hosted by an BlockUIContainer may host children of its own.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the BlockUIContainer elements to host <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> elements within flow content.
[!code-xml[SpanSnippets#_BlockUIXAML](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml#_blockuixaml)]
The following figure shows how this example renders.
![Screenshot: UIElement embedded in flow content](~/add/media/blockuicontainer.png "Screenshot: UIElement embedded in flow content")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the hosted by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer> may directly host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> child. However, the child element hosted by an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer> may host children of its own.
In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_titlexaml](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], wrapping a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> in an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer> is equivalent to setting that <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> as the value of the Child property.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer> elements to host <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> elements within flow content.
[!code-xml[SpanSnippets#_BlockUIXAML](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml#_blockuixaml)]
The following figure shows how this example renders.
![Screenshot: UIElement embedded in flow content](~/add/media/blockuicontainer.png "Screenshot: UIElement embedded in flow content")
The following example shows how to use the Child property programmatically.
[!code-cs[spansnippets#_BlockUI_Child](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_blockui_child)] [!code-vb[spansnippets#_BlockUI_Child](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_blockui_child)]
